messages.message:
Greetings, Austria!

We don't have any immediate discussion points, but thought I would check in with you since it can be dangerous for me if Austria collapses early, and that is a serious risk if Austria is a newbie (not sure if you are).

Suggest that you get Germany on your side early. They will be dangerously exposed if you struggle early. You should ask them to send F Kiel - Denmark with the message to Russia that if he attacks you (with A Warsaw - Galicia instead of Ukraine), he will block them out of Sweden.

Good luck, and have fun!
messages.input:
My response to AUSTRIA:'Greetings, Austria!

We don't have any immediate discussion points, but thought I would check in with you since it can be dangerous for me if Austria collapses early, and that is a serious risk if Austria is a newbie (not sure if you are).

Suggest that you get Germany on your side early. They will be dangerously exposed if you struggle early. You should ask them to send F Kiel - Denmark with the message to Russia that if he attacks you (with A Warsaw - Galicia instead of Ukraine), he will block them out of Sweden.

Good luck, and have fun!'.

messages.message: Greetings to you as well.  I wish you luck and I will certainly keep all of that in mind
messages.input: Message from AUSTRIA:'Greetings to you as well.  I wish you luck and I will certainly keep all of that in mind'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Austria's response to your message seems polite and non-committal, expressing goodwill without revealing much strategic information. It appears to be a standard diplomatic reply without raising any immediate concerns about their intentions.

messages.message: Seems like year one went well for you! Have both Greece and Serbia in the bag! How are your feelings on Italy?
messages.input: My response to AUSTRIA:'Seems like year one went well for you! Have both Greece and Serbia in the bag! How are your feelings on Italy?'.

messages.message: I am friendly with them thus far.  I am open to discussion in general about how we might be able to work together.
messages.input: Message from AUSTRIA:'I am friendly with them thus far.  I am open to discussion in general about how we might be able to work together.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Austria's response indicating a friendly relationship with Italy and a willingness to discuss collaboration demonstrates openness to diplomacy and potential cooperation. This seems like a positive and genuine approach to fostering alliances and managing relationships in the game.

messages.message: Haha I'm sure Turkey would be very alarmed to hear that
messages.input: My response to AUSTRIA:'Haha I'm sure Turkey would be very alarmed to hear that'.

messages.message: Still though, you seem well placed!
messages.input: My response to AUSTRIA:'Still though, you seem well placed!'.

messages.message: Well. I started off friendly with both of them.  haven't exactly figured out what I am going to do yet as I am still waiting to hear from both of them at the moment.  What is your relationship with Italy like at the moment?
messages.input: Message from AUSTRIA:'Well. I started off friendly with both of them.  haven't exactly figured out what I am going to do yet as I am still waiting to hear from both of them at the moment.  What is your relationship with Italy like at the moment?'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Austria's explanation of being friendly with both Italy and Turkey at the beginning of the game and seeking further communication before making decisions reflects a cautious and balanced approach to diplomacy. Their query about your relationship with Italy seems genuine and indicates a willingness to understand the dynamics among the players.

messages.message: There's been some tension as Italy is concerned about my presence in the Mediterranean. However, it seems to be mostly defused. I would prefer to keep things cordial for now
messages.input: My response to AUSTRIA:'There's been some tension as Italy is concerned about my presence in the Mediterranean. However, it seems to be mostly defused. I would prefer to keep things cordial for now'.

messages.message: If you would be interested in a joint attack, I might change my mind and join, but I am also happy to stand by if you see them as an ally
messages.input: My response to AUSTRIA:'If you would be interested in a joint attack, I might change my mind and join, but I am also happy to stand by if you see them as an ally'.

messages.message: lets see where things lie at the end of this year.
messages.input: Message from AUSTRIA:'lets see where things lie at the end of this year.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Austria's response indicating a willingness to wait and assess the situation at the end of the year before considering a joint attack or alliance suggests a prudent and thoughtful approach to decision-making. It demonstrates a cautious and strategic mindset in their interactions.

messages.message: Sure, that's reasonable. I think it will be an interesting year
messages.input: My response to AUSTRIA:'Sure, that's reasonable. I think it will be an interesting year'.

messages.message: Okay, Italy predicted my move to Tuscany, but yyou've been stabbed by Italy as well
messages.input: My response to AUSTRIA:'Okay, Italy predicted my move to Tuscany, but yyou've been stabbed by Italy as well'.

messages.message: They'll probably build in Venetia and try to hit Trieste
messages.input: My response to AUSTRIA:'They'll probably build in Venetia and try to hit Trieste'.

messages.message: Would you be willing to support me into Venice?
messages.input: My response to AUSTRIA:'Would you be willing to support me into Venice?'.

messages.message: probably.  I messed up big time with some crappy communication and then last minute moves.  I think I much prefer playing this game in person then over the computer
messages.input: Message from AUSTRIA:'probably.  I messed up big time with some crappy communication and then last minute moves.  I think I much prefer playing this game in person then over the computer'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Austria's admission of mistakes and preference for in-person gameplay over online suggests a genuine and reflective tone, indicating a desire for clearer communication and a more personal gaming experience. This honest self-assessment may help foster better understanding and cooperation in future interactions.

messages.message: The dynamic is definitely very different.  Typically misorders are rarer playing on line - which also makes them costlier
messages.input: My response to AUSTRIA:'The dynamic is definitely very different.  Typically misorders are rarer playing on line - which also makes them costlier'.
